website_summaries.verdict: Your best option if you're looking for a lightweight tree pruner that can reach even the highest branches.
pros: Secure locking system keeps pole in place
Steel pruner for branches up to 1.125-inches thick and a 15-inch saw for thicker branches
cons: The saw blade is held in place by a wing nut, which can come loose

customer_reviews.title: Love it...wish I would have bought it last year.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness! My new favorite toy!...This is so cool and easy to use I now regret not buying this last year. I have a tree with branches that now are as high as telephone wires that I need to take down. With this I am able to remove one branch at a time. I'm 60, female and 5"2' so if I can do this with ease anyone can. It was shipped in fast time and packaged nicely.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tholen

customer_reviews.title: Both the saw and pruner cut tree limbs like butter. My 88 year old dad was impressed ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. Both the saw and pruner cut tree limbs like butter. My 88 year old dad was impressed when he saw my daughter and I use it and how easy it was to use. She helped me pull the cord. Saved me hours because the saw took no more than a minute to saw through. Tip: if the wingnut gets loose, just re-tighten it. Mine never once came loose after 3 hours of use. Highly recommended! I also bought the Corona RS 7265D Razor Tooth Folding Pruning Saw, 10-Inch Curved Blade  ANOTHER EXCELLENT SAW!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Dear

customer_reviews.title: A Shear Delight. Get it?
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted to cut down one small branch that was near some wires. I now have an almost uncontrollable desire to cut all the small branches from the tree in question. But I shall resist the temptation.
customer_reviews.author: No Name

customer_reviews.title: The latching mechanism is very good and allows several height adjustments that aren't going to ...
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight and cuts well enough. The latching mechanism is very good and allows several height adjustments that aren't going to budge during high stress. Couple of things that could be better is the rope could be less flexible. That makes it difficult to gain leverage to cut small branches. The blade is also extremely flexible making it difficult to cut if you aren't straight. Making the blade thicker will also add weight so it's a win lose situation. It's a good product overall.
customer_reviews.author: jakep

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!  The angle of the blade is perfect and it works with its own weight
customer_reviews.text: This works great! I'm glad I got the manual one with this professional blade instead of a cheap small chain saw extension.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pole pruner / saw
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pole pruner / saw. The saw blade was easy to mount although took some extra tightening with a plier in order not to come loose. It's not heavy but becomes heavier and more difficult to handle once completely extended but that's inherent managing a 14 foot pole. All in all happy with the product. Cuts and saws fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts, but cut could  be better
customer_reviews.text: The cutting blade material appears to be made of soft material and after usage (less than few times) get dents and dings to the place that it will not cut properly.. I was disappointed, because the name Fiskars means something to me.
customer_reviews.author: Roxalot

customer_reviews.title: Stronger material needed for the cord.
customer_reviews.text: The product worked very well. The extension was easily adjusted. The oval shape of the rod made it easier to handle than a round shaped rod. Improvement recommended would be a stronger fray resistant cord. The cord on my fiskar fraied within two weeks of use. Also an information sheet explaining how to use the plastic hand pull would be helpful. I would definitely buy it again if the manufactures replace the cord with better material.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ... and Less Tipsy than a Ladder
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe how easy this is to use, and how powerful. Although some of the reviews for other trimmers brag that they don't have a rope, the high leverage of this made it easy to cut even pretty thick branches. And it reaches very high. I can't believe for years I pulled out the ladder and tried to find a level spot on the ground when this cuts quickly and easily, up to about twenty feet overhead. Incredibly well engineered.
customer_reviews.author: GNH

customer_reviews.title: Bad locking mechanism would not hold.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 8/9/2018, did not use it until today. Purchased because of the name Fiskar. The locking pin did not go deep enough in the pole and keep just grinding a groove in the inner pole when I would saw. I finally gave up and removed the locking mechanism and replaced it with a nut and bolt. Works now! The rope is a constant hassle always in the way and will add a bracket on the bottom to secure the rope. No sense in sending it back guess I got the only screwed up 1. I'll keep with basic models from Fiskar now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stripped locking holes!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. The tool seems to be made well, however they put some really sub-par material in the adjustable hole area. The net result was: you set it into a locked position and as you worked the saw, you wind up stripping the plastic hole enough where the saw jumps out of the locking hole and won't stay locked in anymore. This was really disappointing and too big to realistically send back.
customer_reviews.author: N. Price

customer_reviews.title: Serious Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Broke in the first hour. The locking mechanism snaps into holes in the extension rod, which is made of fiberglass. The holes in the fiberglass are NOT reinforced. It's so silly when companies cut corners and build tools that will instantly break. 30 cents in grommets would have prevented this. Now I'm looking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Zartog the Magnificent

customer_reviews.title: A must to cut high shrubs or prune tree branches.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pole saw, easy to handle and cuts like a dream. Having owned a pole saw by craftsman-Sears years ago I have some knowledge of how they work. While Sears was very good also, this saw is as good if not better than the Sears product. Did the job with out having to climb a ladder to cut branches etc.. To me it is a well engineered product and the price was very fair. Shipping was very fast and no problems at all ordering from Amazon. I will continue to deal with Amazon in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Buys

customer_reviews.title: Very good overall
customer_reviews.text: Have used this lopped several times now (both fully extended down to no extension) and it's mostly good for smaller limbs (less than 2") using the pull piece to cut thru..if limb is too big it can get stuck & be hard to unstick. Have only tried the saw a few times.. it works OK if you're cutting near the trunk -- otherwise, the limb will move too much and be hard to saw through. Overall, very useful for clearing smaller limbs/branches hanging over the house or drive, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Devo

customer_reviews.title: Same issue other mentioned: Locking mechanism breaks and makes sawing impossible.
customer_reviews.text: I had the same issue like other people who provided photos. The fiberglass rod gets damaged very easily by the locking pin and then the handle is not stable anymore while sawing which of course renders the saw useless. I would argue this looks a lot like planned obsolescence. Something I would have not expected from Fiskars. Unfortunately this happened to me a month after being out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: ON

customer_reviews.title: poor material and design
customer_reviews.text: product arrived with cosmetic damage (extremely poor packaging). That was not a big deal but after the first use, the first locking hole (in the extending arm) is wearing - see picture. Now whenever the sawing becomes mildly difficult, the arm slips out. Sawing is now almost impossible. Pruning still works but very frustrated. I needed an extendable saw. This product is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Cuts the tree branches well as it should!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! It’s sturdy. It’s light. It’s sharp. Does its job! I fully extended it and tried it and it worked really well. I was able to cut a bunch of branches to trim our big messy tree in the backyard. The only difficult thing about using this kknd of tool is.. my neck hurts for looking up for ao long! Haha. Was having too much fun cutting branches. Haven’t used the saw tool that came it, yet. Was able to do my job just using the scissor tool. Will update later when I need to saw-cut some thicker branches.
customer_reviews.author: HuzuBarista

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Might be fine for light pruning, but we had an old apple tree that required lots of trimming. This blade was fairly flimsy and the nut holding it keeps coming loose. The extender shaft also is not durable, as the holes that hold the pins keep breaking. This means as I try to saw the extension keeps moving.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase and a must have for homeowners with trees.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a long box fully assembled, except for the saw blade. The blade was easy to attach - just remove the wingnut, install the saw blade through the bolt and reinstall the wingnut. Extending the pole was easy and it locked securely in the fully extended position with both a pin-in-hole device and a clamping device. I needed this pruner to trim some high branches smaller than 1 inch and it cut through them like butter. I removed the saw blade to do the pruning because it kept getting in the way.
customer_reviews.author: TXLou

customer_reviews.title: Handy pole saw cuts well.
customer_reviews.text: WE had an old pole saw on which the rope for the cutter broke. When I looked for it to trim some very small branches of a crape myrtle that were getting into the cable coming to the house, I couldn't find it--we probably loaned it out. A few days after this arrived I used the cutter which was quite sharp and cut through easily. The saw was sharp as well. The only complaint I had is that it took two people to adjust the saw to a longer length. I realize that you don't want something that slips easily out of place, but since there is a locking mechanism, the extensions should move a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Templeton

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Such a great value. I ordered this for my tree in the front yard that branched out over the street and up over my roof. It far exceeded my expectations. The telescoping handle is sturdy and easy to operate. The blade is sharp and sturdy enough for the thicker branches. I was able to take care of my tree is a very short period of time. Now if only it came with someone to dispose of the clippings....
customer_reviews.author: Amanda D.

customer_reviews.title: a necessary tool for a homeowner with lots of trees
customer_reviews.text: The saw blade cuts amazingly through tree branches I could not reach. The pulley system to cut through smaller branches is very sharp and had no problems going through anything I tried. The only reason I took away one star, and this is just me, it this is on the heavy side, so reaching out horizontally over bushes when it is extended was a little difficult to maneuver, but the weight gives it a solid and well-build feel.
customer_reviews.author: gary assassin

customer_reviews.title: worked OK for about a week
customer_reviews.text: When I initially ordered this it arrived 4 days late and I was unable to use it for another week. Now smaller branches and leaves jam up the blade. constantly having to clear it out to cut anything. wish I could return it, but it appears amazon will not allow it as a few weeks went by? Stupid. would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Prime customer

customer_reviews.title: Light duty pruner at best
customer_reviews.text: Item was received with plastic packaging already opened with blade. Kept item as it still works and needed now, did not want to go through return process. It worked to cut the few small branches growing towards house but feels as if it will not last very long as material send to be flexing out of alignment after just twenty minutes of use. Plastic locking mechanism feels as if will break already. Good for extremely light duty and the smallest of branches only.
customer_reviews.author: R.M.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily. Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: The thumb tab for locking the trimmer breaks easily and so the gray extension keeps getting pushed back into the yellow outer sleeve. And, poor design because the locking mechanism is really a small pin going into a hole in the plastic gray extension to lock, and even a small force cause either the pin to break, or the hole in which the pin goes into to fray.
customer_reviews.author: MZ

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Product showed up within 3 days of ordering instead of the 8-10 days it said it was going to take! Guess I know what I’m doing this weekend! Easy to use. Extending the pole is easy. Slides smooth up and down. Male 6ft/150lb, it’s very easy to control/balance. So far I’ve used it to prune some 22ft pine trees that line the side of my property. Cut thru 1inch like butter. Haven’t used the saw blade yet but it’s good and sharp and I expect it will cut like any other saw blade.
customer_reviews.author: Craig F

customer_reviews.title: Old lady can use this.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. Use on tender branches and learn how to balance yourself (hard to do on my sloping overgrown ivy ), and keep hold of the tug rope. You will get the hang of capturing the tree branch in the cutting nipper (unless you find you’ve got the unneeded saw blade jammed further into the branches and snagged the nipper tool into non-functioning). Hey I’m 82 and female.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Eyre

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my 4‘11“ wife is deathly afraid of climbing on a six-foot ladder with a handsaw to trim our elm and pine trees. She loves this thing it is absolutely massacred every tree around our house and even a few neighbors in her delight using it. Lightweight, strong, easy to use and would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Larry E

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of tool to work with!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to use when setting up hunting lanes for archery season. Ha loves it! Says he can reach the limbs he needs to and it cuts so easily, it's light weight and easy to use. This is the second one we have bought, only because we wore the first one out trimming trees for everyone we knew!
customer_reviews.author: Rose Kephart

customer_reviews.title: extremely high quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pole saw that I've purchased...and I've purchased quite a few. Very easy to adjust, heavy duty construction, ad extends to 14 feet. With the 14 ft extension, however, you won't be using this to cut anything that isn't almost directly overhead due to it's weight.
customer_reviews.author: Robin5

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. The saw gets in the way when attached but cuts well. I won't be using it with the saw most of the time. Could lock down a bit tighter when extended. That's the only reason it's getting a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: G. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Allows for Fast and Safe Trimming
customer_reviews.text: I needed a longer pole saw for trimming trees for treestands. This saw performs great. It is sharp, easy to maneuver, and has more than enough reach when fully extended to allow me to work from the ground. The cutter is designed with lots of leverage so that slicing smaller branches is easy as well. If you need a quality pole saw, this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Feels Flimsy at Full Extened Length
customer_reviews.text: Fiskar seems to have a problem providing sharp, long-lasting blades. My short handled pruning saw had the same blade as this pole saw, and quickly wore out. Replaced with a Sonar. The Locking pole is an improvement over the old twist tight lock, but there is only three positions. Added two more by drilling a couple of holes, one each, between the three.. it now has five optional lengths. The small branch cutter is terrific. The rope and handle flops about, and if you're not careful when not using it, could smack you upside the head.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job trimming those overhead branches.
customer_reviews.text: I'm too old to climb ladders so this is very useful for giving my trees a little haircut. I believe I have to be very careful, since I'm not strong, to keep it balanced and not let it fall over and hurt something. It feels heavy to me, but that's ok for a real working tool.
customer_reviews.author: Diane R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: MY HUSBAND LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.text: He has told me 3 times since we purchased it, that it is the best $75 he's ever spent. He's usually very critical, especially about products I have purchased online, but this has met all his expectations, and more. He says it is very sturdy, easy to use, and extremely handy. Would buy it again with no questions asked; in fact, he thought maybe we should get another in case they quit making it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, not too heavy, works great, I should have bought one of these years ago instead of paying "professionals" to do it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best money ive spent in a while
customer_reviews.text: I got this to prun a couple trees in my yard an wow was I impressed the pruning feature works great cuts through any branch you can fit in it with ease. The saw omg... while it does only cut on the pull stroke it takes no time at all to cut through branches I even cut a few that were 4" with no issues. The telescoping works great locks securely an is even quite stiff when fully extended. This is a great tool an I would highly recommend it to anyone
customer_reviews.author: travis bingham

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This seems well made and it's a beauty to use. The saw is great as long as you follow the instructions and only try to cut (w/pressure) on the way down. It's also much cheaper than hiring a crew every time you need to trim your trees! No tips I can think of, considering how easy it is to use, except for maybe don't stand directly under the limb you're cutting!
customer_reviews.author: S Graves

customer_reviews.title: Simple tool that is improved.
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrades to this product. The pole is no longer "round", it is oval shaped so doesn't rotate in your hand or at telescoping extension lock. Extension lock is improved with lever design instead of old screw friction type. No improvement needed on the cutting head, always did work well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid tool
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Very long, which is what I needed. Like the combination of the saw blade and the lopper. The lopper blade is a little small, but between the two, I was able to cut what I needed. The saw blade took some figuring to sort out how to attach. No directions!
customer_reviews.author: S.A.

customer_reviews.title: Reach is good but you need to work hard
customer_reviews.text: Teeth do not cut as good as other trimmers I've had in the past. It seems to glide on the branch and not cut it. It is sturdy and easy to extend and retract.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kerwood

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: We live in deep woods with all sorts of trees and underbrush. A commercial tree service takes care of the big stuff, we do the smaller work. This piece of equipment replaced an older unit that had no saw. The thing is light, works perfectly, and the pruner is more powerful than the old one. The saw cuts on the downstroke so it's easy to control and is very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Submariner409

customer_reviews.title: Great reach but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great reach. Easy for reaching overhead but NOT for reaching diagonally or horizontally due to the weight (NOT light). Cuts great.
customer_reviews.author: NHDeb

customer_reviews.title: Clipper design has mechanical advantage that makes cuttings any limbs that will fit easy
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a short time but so far it does a fine job. The tool is sturdy and the clipper cuts very well. I have not used the saw blade yet. The extension is a little hard to pull out to make it longer but I expect with use and perhaps a little dry lubricant it will get easier.
customer_reviews.author: CycleBum

customer_reviews.title: works well, bought it for trimming palm fronds, ...
customer_reviews.text: works well, bought it for trimming palm fronds, went the manual route didn't want to hoist a power saw 16 or so feet over my head. blade kept coming loose at first dug out some lok-tite took care of that, also added a velcro cable strap to hold the pull cord in place
customer_reviews.author: sk

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME extension trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: So... I am a teacher and use FISKAR scissors in my classroom. They always work well, so I figured I would give this a shot! Price point is GREAT and it works perfectly. Cuts through twigs/branches like butter and saw blade is amazing! Easy to use and assemble! 5 Stars from me!
customer_reviews.author: fcerauli

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to reach high branches without a ladder. The saw blade is nice and sharp, and the pruner works well. It's best to remove the saw blade if you're going to use the pruner because the blade does tend to get in the way. On a couple of larger branches, it took two of us to use the pruner, one to hold the pole with both hands and the other to put the cord with two hands.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: By far the best pole saw you can buy
customer_reviews.text: I seldom provide reviews but I find this to be the absolute best pole saw I have found. That said, I have used pole saws for many years and have never been completely satisfied with any until I bought this one. The locking method used is bullet proof and the blade is unbelievably sharp. Most trimming I do is dealing with oak trees. Both live and laurel oaks. Some of the hardest wood found. I'm confident you would not be disappointed purchasing one of these saws.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! I'm 5'2 and 110 pounds, so am happy that this has a good length to weigh ratio. Most of all I am grateful for the fixed length settings that do not allow the sections to slip while I am sawing tree limbs or palm fronds 16 feet up. The ones that are held only by friction are miserable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Kelly

customer_reviews.title: A good pole saw
customer_reviews.text: Great reach and easy to cut on the backstroke. The pull string for the pruner can get caught when using the saw so be careful. Somewhat difficult to store in my small shed but it does get relatively compact and the saw does come off. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: humanzookeeper

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for high branches
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to trim trees that were about 15 ft up. As a short, out-of-shape woman, I had a little trouble with handling the long length but made it work. I would buy it again. I’ve owned/used this type of trimmer but this one is much longer—which came in handy.
customer_reviews.author: StacyS

customer_reviews.title: another fantastic tool from fiskars
customer_reviews.text: another fantastic tool from fiskars. the saw blade i used quite a few times now. its best when mounted nearly straight along the shaft. the pruner is also very good, and doesnt require a lot of force. itll take down one inch branches like a pro.
customer_reviews.author: nbz59wr

customer_reviews.title: Loved this pruner
customer_reviews.text: Loved this pruner. I am a 70 year old female but I had no trouble clipping and sawing branches from a tree rubbing on a roof. I was able to saw at the full extension. It was a little wabbly but I did it and it only took minutes.
customer_reviews.author: JEY.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best pruners/saws i have ever used. the clippers takes down anything that will fit in the hook. I have used the saw the most to cut fir branches up to 3to 4 inch diameter down with ease. Great product and very sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Too damn heavy!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of this and it was MUCH lighter to use. It is wayyyy too heavy for quick trimming and cutting... I needed it so am keeping it but won't be able to use it without help (I am a fit 65-year-old). Grrrr....
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A.

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed at how easily the cutter went through even quite ...
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how easily the cutter went through even quite large branches -- I guess if the branch fits, it will cut it (maybe wit a little back and forth, but easier than my pruning shears. The saw threw me at first because the cutting edges are toward you, i.e., pull to cut, but worked just fine. My only criticism is that the there should be a cleat to keep the pull cord close to the pole.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for anyone with high branches that need to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for anyone with high branches that need to be maintained. It is not too heavy and easy to maneuver. The cutting mechanism works perfectly for small to medium size branches. The saw attachment works great for bigger branches.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: easy to adjust height, saw and cutter are crazy sharp, the cord to work the cutter could be upgraded to have less stretch but overall this is an easy saw to use that made quick work of maple tree branches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was awesome. Probably saved myself over a thousand dollars using ...
customer_reviews.text: After paying someone to do tree work, I decided to buy one of these. It was awesome. Probably saved myself over a thousand dollars using this thing. The pruning tool was a huge lot useful feature I didn't even consider when I bought this thing. It's very tough, I've done something like 15 hours of tree cutting over 5 days and it is still nearly as sharp as brand new. Great value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Ro

customer_reviews.title: Nice length... sharp saw blades out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Extends longer than most trimmers I have seen... sharp saw blade and sharp slicer... DO NOT ALLOW A HEAVY BRANCH TO FALL ON IT... IT WILL CRACK OR CRUSH
customer_reviews.author: Retired Tom

customer_reviews.title: Painted shut :(
customer_reviews.text: The wing nut was painted shut. I couldn’t get it off to attach the saw blade. Wrote to fiskars warranty, but got no response. The clipper works great though.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Locking mechanism broke
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it worked, but—in the same way as others have shown in their shared pictures—the plastic stripped around the hole that is part the locking mechanism. It's just unusable trash now.
customer_reviews.author: W. B. Knox

customer_reviews.title: GETS THE JOB DONE QUICKLY!
customer_reviews.text: Razor sharp cutter, cuts tough wood like a knife through butter. The telescoping pole is fairly light and plastic is strong with very manageable flex. Has locking device instead of the typically slipping twist lock.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT. S

customer_reviews.title: Great for landscaping and trimming small tree limbs
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t familiar with this type of pruning tool but pleasantly surprised at just how easy it is to use. I was able to trim my young ornamental trees without the use of a ladder. Blade is very sharp easliy cuttng through larger branches up to 1” diameter. May work on thicker branches as well but my trees aren’t that mature as yet.
customer_reviews.author: Claudeo58

customer_reviews.title: The blade would not maintain its sturdiness and could not ...
customer_reviews.text: The blade would not maintain its sturdiness and could not cut with it due to the blade coming loose and wobbly from it's attached position. I had to go and buy a lockwasher that seemed to do the trick. I'm very surprised it didn't come with a washer or some added support to help maintain blade sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R.Norris

customer_reviews.title: Great reach
customer_reviews.text: The pruner has great reach but the blade is too flimsy. I recommend the manufacturer stiffen the blade and make the teeth wider for a better bite.
customer_reviews.author: hogbyte

customer_reviews.title: I’m using it to trim my palm tree.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s extends to 14 ft and has an oval pole so it feels stronger. I’ve used a corona 12 ft and it felt heavier to me.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Oval extension pole makes it much easier to control
customer_reviews.text: Great home tree trimming tool. The pruning cutter is much easier to pull than the older version. Easier for pole extension adjustments too. Very happy and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Security Guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent homeowner pruner
customer_reviews.text: Excellent homeowner pruner. It is long enough for me to prune most of the trees in my yard without having to climb on a ladder at all. N oneed to pay exra money to companies for pruning. Great way to save extra $$$$$
customer_reviews.author: Nataliya_coloradomomlife

customer_reviews.title: If your read the specs and they're sufficient for your needs, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.text: I wish it were capable of being twice as long as it gets, but does a great job cutting within specs. Price here was good. Seems like it will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: trim with ease
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, sturdy to cut and good weight overall. The saw has larger teeth than most trimmers and good cutting tool attachment. Very pleased and strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for pruning
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is a must have for fruit trees. The oblong pole gives extra stiffness. My only complaint was that the two sections of the pole fit very tight and took quite a bit of effort to extend. I hope with some use it will work easier. May try some mica ad a lube.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The first one that was sent had a defect and Amazon was very quick to replace the item. Much appreciated. It's heavy... and a bit awkward if you have never used one before. I'm happy with purchase as it allows me to save a few $$$ by not having to hire a landscaper. :-)
customer_reviews.author: susie sunshine

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works but it can be awkward to use and the string system just isn’t for me
customer_reviews.author: isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Makes tree pruning quick and easy.
customer_reviews.text: This has made tree pruning so much easier. What I thought I was going to have to hire someone to do for me . . . I have been able to do myself from the ground. My yard looks so much better and I feel good to have done the work myself. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: STACY

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: very simple to operate - only assembly is attach saw by unscrewing 1 wingnut and tightening. use the clipper for smaller branches and saw for bigger. not too hard to handle - wouldn't recommend using on a high ladder but on the first step or 2 of a six foot ladder you can reach 20' limbs easily. won't be returning this tool. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Betsey Snide

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pole with great cutting edges.
customer_reviews.text: Great value! The pruning cutter makes quick work of smaller branches. The oval shape of the shaft makes gripping and sawing very comfortable. If the handle on the pull robe could be adjusted with a push button or toggle lever for shorter pole settings, i’d Give it 6 stars.
customer_reviews.author: K. W. Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: The blade is sharp and the pole is strong so it makes cutting the dead branches really easy. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. We have a bunch of queen palms on the property and this allows me to avoid calling a service out to trim them. The blade is sharp and the pole is strong so it makes cutting the dead branches really easy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Z.

customer_reviews.title: Seemed fine, for the most part
customer_reviews.text: Seemed fine, for the most part, for the intended purpose. I ended up returning this because most of the branches I need to reach require the pole to be fully extended. It is wobbly and difficult to control when fully extended. I decided it would be difficult to use in this situation.
customer_reviews.author: Cari

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done easier and faster.
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem with the weight or height and I’m a 69 yo woman with one leg using a manual wheelchair. Removed all the dead wood from one fruitless mulberry tree and starting on another. Every function of this pole worked perfectly. Great pole for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: butitsadryheat

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted - with a fully exposed pull cord vs others that are covered and non-repairable
customer_reviews.text: Have always liked Fiskars products and find this one to be one of their better products - cost effective and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: John Texas

customer_reviews.title: Worked and still doing it's job.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great and still working great. And pole saw worked great. Would recommend this. Had no issues with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband as a replacement for the ones someone borrowed and didn't return. They seem to be a lot better quality than the previous ones. He said he likes them much better. Also the price was only a fraction of some of the others I researched
customer_reviews.author: Trisha A

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome. Does exactly what it's supposed to and is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. Does exactly what it's supposed to and is easy to use. It's pretty fun too. Instead of paying my gardener $500 to trim my tall wall of branches, I used this $45 tool and got the whole job done in a couple hours, which I enjoyed.
customer_reviews.author: ABesserman

customer_reviews.title: It's doing what I want it to do.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It might be a little hard for some too use, but it's doing a great job for me.
customer_reviews.author: Vonjobob

customer_reviews.title: Great tree pruner
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a broken pole pruner. I like the positive locking for the extension. Light weight but sturdy in use. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: LRVR

customer_reviews.title: Hace used and loaned to neighbors
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and will be used for many years to come. Fiskars is a great product and name.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley D Nordlund

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great for me. I especially like how the front is also a lopper for small branches. It is a little more difficult to cut when extended fully, but if the blade is sharp it does the job. You can buy replacement blades for this.
customer_reviews.author: ReadySetGrow128

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Bought This
customer_reviews.text: A great investment for me. I have used it to cut branches away from my power service line, and used it on a 30' ladder to cut branches off of my rooftop TV antenna. Worked great, and I couldn't have done it without this.
customer_reviews.author: R. H.

customer_reviews.title: The best pole pruner I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This Pole pruner is so much better than the one it replaced. The extension pole is easy to extend in 3 locking steps and the blade is very sharp with ample leverage to cut any branch that fits within the jaw. I wish I had purchased this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: W. K.

customer_reviews.title: Good pole saw
customer_reviews.text: I needed to trim a couple of oak trees and this pole saw did the trick. It is sturdy and the blade is of good quality. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: Had doubts as to how well this would work but was plesently surprised to find that it works very well. It CAN be a bit awkward when fully extended if you don’t have decent arm strength but that’s to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality very durable
customer_reviews.text: I know this is a tool but it is gorgeous. Excellent quality very durable
customer_reviews.author: lac

customer_reviews.title: It is what is says it is
customer_reviews.text: Saw and pruner on a LONG stick. Handles pretty well fully extended. Starts out really sharp, both lopper and saw. Seems well built and durable. Better than my previous version (different brand) by 100%.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Good pole position.
customer_reviews.text: A massive improvement over the previous design, which slipped and did not hold extension. This is fine in that regard. It's not infinitely adjustable - there are set "stop" positions - but its works well and Im pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: IraLA

customer_reviews.title: Best Pole Pruner
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this the only pole pruner that I have tried that actually works, but is works very well. Cuts branches off clean without slipping off. Saw is amazing. If you need a pole pruner get this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done for me.
customer_reviews.text: Had a very large live oak that needed trimming near house. This worked great. Even on the very high branches on full extension. For the average DIY it’s perfect. However I don’t think this would suffice for a lawn and garden business as it seems better suited to lighter duty. Wear a helmet!! Those branches from up high come down with a lot of force.
customer_reviews.author: Guss S.

customer_reviews.title: Lumberjack
customer_reviews.text: Used this where I didn't trust myself on a ladder with a chainsaw. Works GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: cturboaddict

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: well made & easy to use for those rare occasions
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: my husband used it said it worked great handle easy to hold and fits the hand well good reach and cuts real well without a lot of effort
customer_reviews.author: maureen koscielak

product_meta.title: Fiskars 393981-1001 502999 14' Extend Tree Pruner, 14 Inch
product_meta.description: High branches are within reach with the Power-Lever Extendable Pole Saw & Pruner, which includes two different cutting options and extends up to 14 feet. Unique Power-Lever technology increases leverage to give you up to 2X more power than traditional designs. Plus, oval-shaped, lightweight yet strong poles reduce flex, allow you to control the direction of the cut and fit the natural shape of your hand. A unique double locking system ensures the pole stays extended for superior control. Trim branches as thick as 1-1/8 inch with the sharp, durable steel pruner boasting a special low-friction coating for smooth cuts, reduced gumming and enhanced rust resistance. For thicker branches, call on the power of the sturdy 15 inch WoodZig saw.
feature_bullets: Easily cut high branches with a sturdy tree trimming system that extends 14 feet and features Power-Lever technology for up to 2X more power
Includes a precision-ground steel pruner for cutting branches up to 1-1/8 inch thick and a 15 inch WoodZig saw for removing larger branches
Oval-shaped fiberglass poles greatly reduce flex, allow you to control the cut direction and fit the natural shape of your hand
Secure double locking system ensures the extended pole stays put. Maintenance : Clean with mild detergent. Oil pivot points for smooth operation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars613 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
